page.title: 14FISHING IN SW.BOGNOR REGIS
page.content: There are two kinds of{fishermen}to be seen in the area.{Commercial fishermen are to be found by the{Pier}and at {Gray's Beach.}It is an unwritten rule that only these fishermen are allowed to fish in these spots.They fish about 6-10km out at sea.Each fisherman has a 5.6m,fibre glass boat powered by a 10h.p outboard motor.Their catch varies from day to day and from season to season.In the summer they mainly catch{shellfish and lobsters}and in the winter{white fish.}They sell their catch to local restaurants or on the sea-front to passers-by.One fisherman has been there for fifty years and his family before him.Although he had enjoyed his job he would not recommend it as the catches are now too small and as it is becoming too commercial. {Non-commercial fishermen}pay 50p to fish off the{Pier.
